purpose: Provides structural support, protection for internal organs, and the framework for muscle attachment and movement. Produces blood cells and stores minerals.

interfaces.name: Musculoskeletal Integration
interfaces.description: Enables movement and support through interaction with muscular system. Verified by anatomy and physiology literature.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (Gray's Anatomy, PubMed)

interfaces.name: Mineral Exchange
interfaces.description: Stores and releases minerals (e.g., calcium, phosphorus) into the bloodstream, interacting with cardiovascular system.
interfaces.source_verification: Existing - verified by authoritative sources (NCBI, physiology textbooks)

verification_notes: Based on established anatomical and physiological sources.

justification.rationale: Standard anatomical model; all interfaces are well-documented in literature.
